p: The antioxidant activities of essential oil of M. spicata were determined by DPPH, ABTS and FRAP. The results are summarized in Table 2. In DPPH, the assessed sample was able to reduce the stable violet DPPH radical to the yellow DPPH-H, reaching 50% of reduction with IC 50 value of (3450 ± 172.5 μg/mL). Relative to the potent antioxidant agents, ascorbic acid (IC 50 = 2.22 ± 0.04 μg/mL) and BHT (15.20 ± 0.02 μg/mL), M. spicata exhibits weak antioxidant potential. Interestingly, essential oil of M. spicata grown in Iran demonstrated better antioxidant activity (81.66 μg/mL) [ 30], similar to that reported from Turkey (77.40 μg/mL) [ 31] and Egypt (63.80 μg/mL) [ 32].
